name: Shibuya Sky
description: Unlock mesmerizing city views at Shibuya Sky, Tokyo's premier observation deck. A large complex facility that is directly connected to Shibuya Station, 47 floors above the ground, 229m high.

name: Tokyo SkyTree
description: Tokyo Skytree is a broadcasting and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo. It reached its full height of 634 meters (2,080 ft) in March 2011, making it the tallest tower in the world

name: Tokyo Joypolis
description: Tokyo Joypolis in Odaiba is a roofed theme park offering fun and entertainment even in the rain. Enjoy thrilling rides and the latest virtual-reality (VR) content on over 20 different attractions: a full day out for the family!

name: Ghibli Museum
description: The Ghibli Museum is dedicated to the studio's work, as well as to illuminating the mechanics of the world of animation. Even though there are many references to the lovable films within the museum, you don’t have to be a Studio Ghibli fan to appreciate the amazing artistry on display, or be completely charmed by the exhibits!

name: Ghibli Park
description: Ghibli Park is a theme park about the popular animated movies by Studio Ghibli. It opened in November 2022 just outside Nagoya, and unlike other theme parks does not feature any rides, but rather lets visitors delve into the atmospheric fantasy worlds presented in the various popular Ghibli movies.

name: Toro Nagashi
description: Toro nagashi started when the bereaved families and citizens who lost their relatives and acquaintances in the atomic bomb flushed handmade lanterns into the river for the sake of remedy and memorial service. Recently, the sight of people from Japan and abroad writing their thoughts on peace has become more prominent. Toro nagashi, which has a long history, has become meaningful for both memorial services and peace messages.

name: Mt. Fuji Yoshida trail
description: The most famous and easiest route to climb Mt. Fuji with 10 stations. Accessible from Tokyo by bus, it only takes about 6h to reach the top.

name: Mt. Fuji climb Fujinomiya trail
description: A shorter route to climb Mt. Fuji, taking only about 4:30h to reach the top of the mountain but much steeper.

name: Mt. Fuji Subashiri trail
description: Located on the east side of the mountain. Much less crowded but with less shelters and services.

name: Mt. Fuji Gotemba trail
description: The longest route, takes a minimum of 7h to reach the top. Keep in mind that it has less shelters and you'll only find them when you're close to the top.

name: Gozan No Okuribi (Daimonji)
description: Gozan no Okuribi, more commonly known as Daimonji, it is the culmination of the Obon festival on August 16, in which five giant bonfires are lit on mountains surrounding the city to guide the spirits back  to send off ancestor's spirits to the other side.

name: Tokyo Disneyland
description: It was the first Disney park to be built outside the United States and it opened on April 15, 1983. The park was constructed by WED Enterprises in the same style as Disneyland in California and Magic Kingdom in Florida.

name: Tokyo DisneySea
description: Tokyo DisneySea is a fantasy theme park in Tokyo Disney Resort that is unique to Japan. While suitable for all ages, it was designed to specifically also appeal to a more grown up audience.

name: Universal Studios Japan
description: Universal Studios Japan offers world-class entertainment such as authentic attractions and shows, based not only on Hollywood blockbusters but also popular entertainment brands such as Harry Potter and Nintendo World.

name: Gion Matsuri
description: Gion Matsuri, held in Kyoto's geisha district, is one of Japan's most famous and largest annual festivals, featuring spectacular processions of floats and traditional performances.

name: Tenjin Matsuri
description: Tenjin Matsuri is one of Japan's top three festivals, featuring colorful boat processions on the Okawa River and lively street parades.

name: Awa Odori
description: The Awa Odori festival in Tokushima attracts thousands of dancers who perform traditional Awa dance routines in the streets, creating a lively and energetic atmosphere.

name: Nebuta Matsuri
description: Nebuta Matsuri is renowned for its impressive illuminated paper lantern floats depicting historical and mythical figures.

name: Hanagasa Matsuri
description: Hanagasa Matsuri features traditional dance performances and flower-decorated straw hats, creating a vibrant, flower-filled spectacle.

name: Yamaga Toro Matsuri
description: Yamaga Toro Matsuri is known for its stunning display of 30,000 bamboo lanterns that illuminate the streets during the evening.

name: Sendai Tanabata Matsuri
description: Sendai Tanabata Matsuri features colorful paper decorations adorning the city streets and is a celebration of the Tanabata (Star Festival) tradition.

name: Tokyo Tower
description: Tokyo Tower is a communications and observation tower in the Shiba-koen district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan. It is the second-tallest structure in Japan.

name: Cherry Blossom Hanami
description: Hanami, meaning 'flower viewing,' is the centuries-old Japanese tradition of welcoming spring. It is the act of appreciating the transient beauty of flowers, especially cherry blossoms (sakura).

name: Hakone hot springs
description: Hakone is famous as one of the best onsen areas in Japan. Onsen refers to natural hot springs and bathing facilities found throughout Japan. It is a beloved tradition and a relaxing way to experience the country's geothermal wonders.

name: Kimi no Na wa (Your Name) stairs
description: The iconic stairs in the anime movie 'Your Name' (Kimi no Nawa) have captured the hearts of anime fans, otaku, and travelers alike. These stairs, located in the bustling city of Tokyo, have become a must-visit location for fans of the movie, who come from all over the world to experience this slice of anime magic in real life.

name: Suzume no Tojimari door
description: Built by the The tourism association of Kusu after Makoto Shinkai's lastest movie: 'Suzume', in which a high school girl shuts 'doors' across the country connecting to another world to contain quakes and other calamities.

name: Kumano Kodo Trail
description: The Kumano Kodo Pilgrimage Route is one of the world's premier spiritual roads. Winding through the mountains of Honshu's Kii Peninsula, an area straddling Wakayama, Nara, Osaka and Mie prefectures, it's been walked by pilgrims on their quest for enlightenment for over a millennium.

name: teamLab Borderless
description: teamLab Borderless is a world of artworks without boundaries, a museum without a map created by art collective teamLab. Artworks move out of rooms, relate to other works, influence each other, and at times intermingle, without boundaries. Through this group of works, one continuous world without boundaries is created.

name: teamLab Planets
description: teamLab Planets is a museum where you walk through water, and a garden where you become one with the flowers. It comprises 4 large-scale artwork spaces and 2 gardens created by art collective teamLab. Visitors go barefoot and immerse their entire bodies in the vast artworks together with others. The artworks change under the presence of people, blurring the perception of boundaries between the self and the works.

name: Himeji Castle
description: Himeji Castle is regarded as the finest surviving example of prototypical Japanese castle architecture, comprising a network of 83 rooms with advanced defensive systems from the feudal period. It is the largest and most visited castle in Japan, and it was registered in 1993 as one of the first UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the country.

name: JR Shimonada Station
description: Known as the station closest to the sea in Japan, Shimonada Station has been featured in many drama, movie, and anime. It is said to have inspired the train station in Spirited Away.

name: Hakone Open Air Museum
description: The Hakone Open-Air Museum, opened in 1969, is Japan's first open-air museum. The museum is the perfect spot to go for a leisurely stroll surrounded by nature, all the while appreciating great art. Needless to say, it's a popular spot for impressive Instagram snaps.

name: Site of Reversible Destiny
description: The Site of Reversible Destiny (Yoro Park) is one of the art/architectural works of the internationally acclaimed artists/architects Shusaku Arakawa + Madeline Gins. The park is an invitation to visitors to encounter unexpected wonders that may happen every second through their bodies, and to discover incredible possibilities within themselves.
